data.title: Atom randomly disables my Wacom tablet
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [YES] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)? 
* [YES] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [YES] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [YES] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [YES] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [YES] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

Recently, Atom started randomly preventing my Wacom tablet from being able to click or select anything. It works fine if I just stay in Atom, but if I switch to another program, then back to Atom, the tablet stops functioning normally. 

This only happens when I have Atom open, but it effects all applications. For example, if I start Atom, switch to Chrome, then back to Atom, then back to Chrome, I now can't click/select anything with the tablet in any app (not just Atom).

When I don't have Atom open, the issue does not occur.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Switch to another application
3. Switch back to Atom (Wacom tablet will now not click or select anything)

### Versions

Atom: 1.12.7
Mac: Sierra, 10.12

data.title: Multiple useless "apm" processes is generated
data.body:
### Description

Multiple "apm" processes is run, even if I don't install / uninstall any packages to Atom. Even if i close all Atom windows, "apm" processes is still running. 

Screenshot from today: 
![apm-memory-leak](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900316/21385721/f4dfb128-c76f-11e6-9c03-f85efbd23f2f.png)

Yesterday, I had tens of "apm" processes running, which eated more than 1 GB of RAM. I had to do hard-reset of my computer. 


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom editor. 
2. Open few new instances of Atom editor again. 
3. Close all Atom's windows except the first one. 

**Expected behavior:** No "apm" process should run, if I don't play with instaling / uninstaling / searching packages. 

**Actual behavior:** Several "apm" processes is runing. 

### Versions

Atom 1.12.7; Linux Mint 17.2

data.title: Extremely sluggish performance when dragging 'tabs' (splitting)
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

### Description

Atom freezes when 'dragging' tabs from one pane another (within the same window or across windows) or when attempting to create a pane through dragging.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch Atom
2. Open two files.
3. Drag one of the tabs so that part of the existing editor viewport gets highlighted (split zone indicator).

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Fast performance while dragging

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Sluggish performance, very slow visual update of tab movement.

### Versions

This issue is probably a regression. It started recently and manifests itself in 1.12.7 on macOS 10.12.2.

data.title: Don't use ctrl-alt-letter keyboard shortcuts
data.body:
### Description

On Windows, ` ctrl-alt` , also known as AltGr, is a modifier used for entering national characters. If a keyboard shortcut using `ctrl-alt`  is assigned in Atom, it blocks the possibility to enter these characters. At lest two such shortcuts are assigned by the core module.

    'body':
      'ctrl-alt-o': 'application:add-project-folder'

    'atom-workspace atom-text-editor:not([mini])':
      'ctrl-alt-z': 'editor:checkout-head-revision'

Polish keyboard uses the following keys: a, c, e, l, n, o, s, x, z, also with ` shift`  modifier. Other languages may use other keys. As a general rule, programmers should not use ` ctrl-alt-letter`  keyboard shortcuts.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AltGr_key

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set the keyboard layout to Polish (programmers).
2. In Atom editor, press ` ctrl-alt-o`  and ` ctrl-alt-z` 

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
Characters `ó` and ` ż`  are entered

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Functions "Open project folder" and "Checkout HEAD revision" are activated.

### Versions

Atom    : 1.12.7
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
apm  1.12.9
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.4.windows.1
visual studio 2015

Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]

data.title: Fix bad title bar path when viewing files not in a project folder
data.body:
In cases where the active pane item has a path that is not inside a current project folder, we display the first project folder in the title bar. This can be misleading. For instance, with a project setup like this:

```
project
└ folder1
  └ package.json
└ folder2
  └ package.json
```

If we open `~/random/path/package.json`, the title bar will show `package.json — folder1`, which is incorrect. This made more sense previously, when the project only contained a single folder, but now the behavior seems misleading.

In order to provide the most pertinent information, this PR changes the behavior to the following:

* If the active pane item has a path that is included in a project folder, we show `item title — project folder` (as is the current behavior)
* If the active pane item has a path that is NOT included in a project folder, we show `item title — path to file` (where the path does not include the filename — in the example above, it'd be `~/random/path`)
* If there is no active pane item (i.e., the pane is empty), we simply show `untitled`

Fixes #5058
Fixes #5585
Fixes #10710

/cc @atom/feedback

data.title: Atom doesn't correctly identify the XML file type if it is not saved with the .xml extension
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

### Description

[Here is an example](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5nnbh1lu15jtt6u/page.mucow?dl=1). A .MuCow is a XML extension used for creating Adobe Muse widgets. Atom will always identify the file as an HTML file despite the opening tag being `<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>`

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open [this file](https://www.dropbox.com/s/5nnbh1lu15jtt6u/page.mucow?dl=1)
2. Check the file type in the bottom right corner. _Every once in awhile, it will correctly identify the file type when it's first opened. Close the file and reopen it and you'll see the file type is now HTML. If it isn't, then I'll go to the store, buy a hat, and then eat my hat._
3. Scream, "This shouldn't be identified as an HTML file!"
4. Work your magic

### Versions

1.12.7 and 1.13.0-beta8

data.body:

* [x] Did you check the [debugging guide]? YED also cleared current state
* [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss]? YES

### Description

WHen heading to my atom settings. upon clicking on packages/themes/updates tabs they get stuck loading there respective items. Packages says "Loading packages..." and the search function does nothing. The themes is the same way stuck on "Loading Thmes..." and the search fucntion does nothing. Updates is stuck on "Checking for updates"

data.title: International layouts: ctrl-{smth}
data.body: Running latest Atom on Xubuntu 16.04, when switching to Russian kb layout, ctrl-c and other ctrl-modified keys stop resolving to the commands needed.

data.title: Use package-specific transpilation options during tests
data.body:
Turns out that packages were not transpiled using the transpiler under `atomTranspilers` during tests due to the way the test window is initialized. This fixes that issue.

/cc @atom/core

data.title: Some editor DOM operations stop working correctly after a certain number of lines
data.body:
#### Scrollbar

We render a scrollbar by creating a div with a height that reflects the editor's screen line count. Unfortunately DOM nodes' heights seem to be bounded:

![max-height](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/326587/21280897/adccf898-c39d-11e6-8e62-fb6b682ed2c2.png)

Reported by @ungb and @Ben3eeE 

#### Decoration rendering

Absolutely-positioned elements like cursors stop rendering correctly after a certain number of lines. It seems that DOM nodes' `top` property has a hard upper bound.

/cc @nathansobo @as-cii Any ideas on how to solve this?

data.title: Atom don't auto reload file content when changed outside
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [* ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
* [* ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
* [* ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
* [ *] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
* [ *] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
* [* ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.

### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
Atom don't auto reload file content when changed outside

### Steps to Reproduce

1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.


When I change a file outside of Atom(for example: git branch change), atom don't auto reload the content

data.title: Atom displays crashed windows upon launch [Mac]
data.body:
### Description

Opening Atom from the app icon or from Terminal causes one or more blank windows to load with a misplaced sheet that says "the editor has crashed" (see screenshot).

![screenshot 2016-12-15 22 48 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/91656/21254639/7f60c264-c31b-11e6-95df-be0883e6840c.PNG)

Despite the crashed windows, a new and fully functional editor window will still open in the background.

This effect occurs with the latest version of Atom (including Safe mode), even after a fresh install with the previous user, support, and cache folders cleared.

Launching using `atom -f` gives the following output in the Terminal:

```
jesse@DOWNiMac ~ $ atom -f
[35612:1215/224810:INFO:CONSOLE(975)] "/deep/ combinator is deprecated. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/6750456638341120 for more details.", source: /Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js (975)
[35612:1215/224810:INFO:CONSOLE(975)] "::shadow pseudo-element is deprecated. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/6750456638341120 for more details.", source: /Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js (975)
2016-12-15 22:49:16.377 Atom[35612:453728] Cannot read property 'substr' of null
2016-12-15 22:49:16.384 Atom[35612:453728] TypeError: Cannot read property 'substr' of null
    at AtomWindow.module.exports.AtomWindow.getLoadSettings (/Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/main-process/atom-window.js:149:71)
    at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.saveState (/Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/main-process/atom-application.js:920:37)
    at BrowserWindow.<anonymous> (/Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/main-process/atom-window.js:206:35)
    at emitOne (events.js:96:13)
    at BrowserWindow.emit (events.js:188:7)
```

From system.log:
```
Dec 15 22:47:23 DOWNiMac kernel[0]: Sandbox: Atom(35612) System Policy: deny file-write-unlink /Users/jesse/Library/Saved Application State/com.github.atom.savedState/restorecount.plist
Dec 15 22:48:01 DOWNiMac kernel[0]: Atom (map: 0xffffff80472981e0) triggered DYLD shared region unnest for map: 0xffffff80472981e0, region 0x7fff8a600000->0x7fff8a800000. While not abnormal for debuggers, this increases system memory footprint until the target exits.
Dec 15 22:49:16 DOWNiMac.local Atom[35612]: Cannot read property 'substr' of null
Dec 15 22:49:16 DOWNiMac.local Atom[35612]: TypeError: Cannot read property 'substr' of null
	    at AtomWindow.module.exports.AtomWindow.getLoadSettings (/Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/main-process/atom-window.js:149:71)
	    at AtomApplication.module.exports.AtomApplication.saveState (/Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/main-process/atom-application.js:920:37)
	    at BrowserWindow.<anonymous> (/Applications/Development/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/main-process/atom-window.js:206:35)
	    at emitOne (events.js:96:13)
	    at BrowserWindow.emit (events.js:188:7)
```

### Versions

Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.5
Atom    : 1.12.7
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.12.9
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.8
git 2.11.0

data.title: Latest Atom on Windows 10 Regains focus with delay
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* The issue is reproducible for me every time I want to use/open/focus Atom with a project open
* I am running the latest stable version of Atom 1.12.7 on Windows 10 64-bit
* I did debug as much as I could and have included the information below
* I have checked the FAQ and found nothing of use related to this issue
* This is being reported as an Atom core issue on the Atom/Atom repository.
* I have searched and found other issues similar in nature but not exact to this issue, and was requested by a few members of the community to create this issue.

### Description

When opening Atom for the first time, or when clicking off Atom to "lose focus" and then clicking back in to paste/type into Atom the application seems to hang for roughly 700-900ms (800ms on average). This is not only annoying to have to wait nearly a second to even use Atom but its gotten to the point where myself and a few other community members have switched to alternative editors whilst this is being fixed.

I have cleared out everything imaginable on my system to "Fresh Install" atom.

- Standard Uninstalled
- Removed all Atom packages
- Deleted `~/.atom/`
- Deleted `~/AppData/Local/Atom/`
- Deleted `~/AppData/Roaming/Atom/`

Once I fresh installed Atom I even tried disabling certain Atom functions know to cause some delay from the other issues on GitHub Atom/Atom.

- Anything git related
- The filetree/sidebar

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Have a project folder open
2. Experience input delay

OR

1. Have a project folder open
2. Refocus Atom
3. Experience input delay

**Expected behavior:** 
Atom should (and used to) focus the window immediately and text could be pasted or typed without delay (sub 100ms). 

**Actual behavior:** 
Atom hangs, with something in the background being ran/processed for 800ms or so, and the user is left to wait it out, and then can use the program as needed after the second or so delay.

### Screenshots and GIF video

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2348814/21235771/d863d472-c2bd-11e6-8f5a-1f0a5f8f3615.png)

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2348814/21235774/d9e301a6-c2bd-11e6-9a91-e16c7a883080.png)

![atom_issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2348814/21235760/cb2c4bae-c2bd-11e6-9033-29ccae85bad7.gif)


### Suggestions / thoughts

I think the issue is related to something that is checked with files. When git packages are disabled the issue still exists. Hence this issue being different than the slow git refresh issue. 

To fix this I would imagine digging to find the issue/cause and changing whatever task from being 1st priority enough to "hang" the app. To a much lower more back-grounded task, something that even if it must take 800ms, for it to not interfere with the user's experience, and input.

I am able and willing to help out with this issue as needed. Just @d4rkd0s me.

#### Linked / similar issues (not the same but should aid in discovery)

#9544 Atom is slow regaining focus on Windows 7 with git repo
#8851 Atom unresponsive when switching between windows on desktop
#7275 Frequent recurring freezing on Windows

#### Other users reporting the same issue

These users have reported issues without a .git project open

- @lautjy
- @PaulBGD
- @BallzofFury

### Versions

Windows: Windows 10 Pro (licensed 64 bit)
Version: 1607
Build: 14393.479
Specs: 16GB RAM i7 3770k GTX1070

Atom    : 1.12.7
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

apm  1.12.9
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5

python 2.7.12
git 2.9.2.windows.1
visual studio 2015
